result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
09:59 AM Defendant Evan R Trewyn in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.
Court passes matter to allow defendant to complete the petition for appointment of counsel.
Case recalled at 10:15.
Court reviews and grants the petition for appointment of counsel.  Defendant to pay $100.00 per month commencing 7/8/22 and the 8th of each month thereafter.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on April 21, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses A & B/Donnie Boys Bar located at 362 West Main Street, in the City of Waukesha listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:58 PM Defendant Evan R Trewyn in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, Taylor Olson.   SPD Intern appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Alyssa Jay, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
